page.title: 16Woodham Ferrers School
page.content: The present school was opened in 1968 on the site of the Victorian Church school it replaced. Until recent years the school served not only the village itself but Bicknacre as well. With the building of new schools at Bicknacre and South Woodham numbers on roll have dropped at the present time to 40. The school has two full time teachers, secretary, cook and lunchtime supervision. Part time help is also available. The building has 3 classroomsa small hall and offices. It is centrally heated by oil. The school is church aided and the Rector is J W Stone. There is a small playing field to the west of the school. Children do not have to be Anglican to attend. The curriculum covers mathematics, English, history and geography as integrated subjects science, music games RE & topic work.
